briefdescription.para: Segment number where the connection to the map point is attached. -1 if no balloon needed (e.g. if point is contained in frame)
First segment point for drawing the connection (ccw direction)
Second segment point for drawing the balloon connection (ccw direction)
Associated feature, or invalid feature if no feature associated.
Fill symbol used for drawing annotation.
Size of the frame (without balloon)
True if the item stays at the same map position, false if the item stays on same screen position.
Associated layer (or nullptr if not attached to a layer)
Map position (for fixed position items)
CRS of the map position.
Point symbol that is to be drawn at the map reference location.
Describes the shift of the item content box to the reference point.
Relative position (for non-fixed items) (0-1)
Constructor for QgsAnnotation.
Returns the feature associated with the annotation, or an invalid feature if none has been set.
Clones the annotation, returning a new copy of the annotation reflecting the annotation's current state.
Returns the margins (in millimeters) between the outside of the frame and the annotation content.
Returns the symbol that is used for rendering the annotation frame.
Returns the annotation's frame's offset from the mapPosition() reference point.
Returns the size of the annotation's frame (the main area in which the annotation's content is drawn).
Returns true if the annotation is attached to a fixed map position, or false if the annotation uses a position relative to the current map extent.
Returns true if the annotation is visible and should be rendered.
Returns the map layer associated with the annotation.

detaileddescription.para:
Annotations can be associated with a map layer if their visibility should be synchronized with the layer's visibility.
setMapLayer()

briefdescription.para: Returns the map position of the annotation, if it is attached to a fixed map position.
Returns the CRS of the map position, or an invalid CRS if the annotation does not have a fixed map position.
Returns the symbol that is drawn at the annotation's map position.
Restores the annotation's state from a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
Derived classes should call _readXml() within their implementation of this method.
writeXml()
_readXml()

briefdescription.para: Returns the relative position of the annotation, if it is not attached to a fixed map position.

detaileddescription.para:
The coordinates in the return point should be between 0 and 1, and represent the relative percentage for the position compared to the map width and height.
setRelativePosition()

briefdescription.para: Renders the annotation to a target render context.
Sets the feature associated with the annotation.
Sets the margins (in millimeters) between the outside of the frame and the annotation content.
Sets the fill symbol used for rendering the annotation frame.

detaileddescription.para:
Ownership of the symbol is transferred to the annotation.
fillSymbol()

briefdescription.para: Sets the annotation's frame's offset from the mapPosition() reference point.
Sets the size of the annotation's frame (the main area in which the annotation's content is drawn).
Sets whether the annotation is attached to a fixed map position, or uses a position relative to the current map extent.
Sets the map layer associated with the annotation.

detaileddescription.para:
Annotations can be associated with a map layer if their visibility should be synchronized with the layer's visibility.
mapLayer()

briefdescription.para: Sets the map position of the annotation, if it is attached to a fixed map position.
Sets the CRS of the map position.
Sets the symbol that is drawn at the annotation's map position.

detaileddescription.para:
Ownership of the symbol is transferred to the annotation.
markerSymbol()

briefdescription.para: Sets the relative position of the annotation, if it is not attached to a fixed map position.

detaileddescription.para:
The coordinates in the return point should be between 0 and 1, and represent the relative percentage for the position compared to the map width and height.
relativePosition()

briefdescription.para: Sets whether the annotation is visible and should be rendered.
Writes the annotation state to a DOM element.

detaileddescription.para:
Derived classes should call _writeXml() within their implementation of this method.
readXml()
_writeXml()

briefdescription.para: Emitted whenever the annotation's appearance changes.
Emitted when the map layer associated with the annotation changes.
Emitted when the annotation's position has changed and items need to be moved to reflect this.

This method should be called from subclasses in their readXml method.

This method should be called from subclasses in their writeXml method.

briefdescription.para: Copies common annotation properties to the targe annotation.

detaileddescription.para: Can be used within QgsAnnotation::clone() implementations to assist with creating copies.

briefdescription.para: Returns the minimum frame size for the annotation.

detaileddescription.para: Subclasses should implement this if they cannot be resized smaller than a certain minimum size.

briefdescription.para: Renders the annotation's contents to a target /a context at the specified /a size.

detaileddescription.para: Derived classes should implement their custom annotation drawing logic here.

briefdescription.para: Draws the annotation frame to a destination painter.
Draws the map position marker symbol to a destination painter.

memberdef.argsstring: (QPointF startPoint, QPointF directionPoint, double distance) const
memberdef.name: pointOnLineWithDistance

briefdescription.para: Returns a point on the line from startPoint to directionPoint that is a certain distance away from the starting point.
Gets the frame line (0 is the top line, 1 right, 2 bottom, 3 left)
Check where to attach the balloon connection between frame and map point.
Abstract base class for annotation items which are drawn over a map.

detaileddescription.para: QgsAnnotation is an abstract base class for map annotation items. These annotations can be drawn within a map, and have either a fixed map position (retrieved using mapPosition()) or are placed relative to the map's frame (retrieved using relativePosition()). Annotations with a fixed map position also have a corresponding QgsCoordinateReferenceSystem, which can be determined by calling mapPositionCrs().
Derived classes should implement their custom painting routines within a renderAnnotation() override.
